definition: theatrical work (play, opera, TV series etc)/dramatic (change, increase etc)/acute/severe
to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion

sentences.english: Today’s upheaval did not occur from nowhere. The seeds were planted earlier.
sentences.chinese: 當今的劇變並非憑空發生，這些種子早已埋下。

sentences.english: But three decades of gut-wrenching change are testing those old bonds.
sentences.chinese: 但三十年的劇變給那些傳統關係帶來考驗。

sentences.english: Other commodities, like oil futures and steel, are also taking the rollercoaster ride.
sentences.chinese: 其他商品如原油期貨和鋼鐵的價格也發生了劇變。

sentences.english: This is also the result of historical trends and situational changes.
sentences.chinese: 這是歷史潮流所向，時勢劇變所致。

sentences.english: The current upheaval is changing the landscape yet again.
sentences.chinese: 當前這場劇變將再次調整世界的景觀。

sentences.english: The extent of the changed fortunes for the product became truly evident recently, when year-end sales tallies were calculated.
sentences.chinese: 該產品命運的劇變在年終銷售數據總結時得到了證實。

sentences.english: After the cataclysms livestock will die for lack of feed or be eaten.
sentences.chinese: 劇變過後，家畜將因宰殺或缺乏飼料而死亡。

sentences.english: When weather changes or physical discomfort will ask people whether they feel hot, show the utmost solicitude.
sentences.chinese: 逢天氣劇變或身體不適便噓寒問暖，關懷備至。

sentences.english: Owing to the decline of the flouring age, the mentality of the poets in the late Tang Dynasty experienced great changes.
sentences.chinese: 盛世劇變的晚唐，詩人的心態發生了巨大變化。

sentences.english: Then, because of the strife in the household, Hagar leaves for the second time.
sentences.chinese: 那時，由於家中劇變，夏甲第二次離家。

sentences.english: Following that advice will protect you from the worst of economic upheavals.
sentences.chinese: 聽從這句忠告能保護你安然度過最糟的經濟劇變。

sentences.english: China may yet undergo internal upheavals that could disrupt its economy.
sentences.chinese: 中國可能還不會醞釀導致經濟崩潰的內部劇變。

sentences.english: In the aftermath of drastic changes in Eastern Europe, socialist movements around the world sank into a low tide.
sentences.chinese: 蘇東劇變後，世界社會主義運動陷入低潮。

sentences.english: What will be its implications for the future?
sentences.chinese: 這場劇變將給未來產生怎樣的影響？

sentences.english: After the drastic change of Soviet Union and Eastern Europe, the global socialist sport meets with the great setback.
sentences.chinese: 蘇東劇變後，全球社會主義運動遭遇重大挫折。

sentences.english: The mechanics of risk management are also in upheaval.
sentences.chinese: 風險管理的過程亦在經歷劇變。

definition: variant of 動蕩|动荡[dong4 dang4]
could happen at any moment/on the verge
to surge like a gathering storm (idiom)/to grow by leaps and bounds
in an instant a myriad changes (idiom); rapid substantial change
to intensify/to sharpen/to accelerate/to aggravate/to exacerbate/to embitter
turbulent situation/changing (face, scene, situation, world of etc)
